body_html:
optimizer.minimize(loss, var_list=[your variables]) will optimize over the list of variables.

But is there a way to optimize over a subset of a given variable while treating the rest of it as constants? What I mean is : say I have a 2D variable named W_fc of size 2x2. I want to optimize over W_fc[0][0] and W_fc[1][1] and treat W_fc[0][1] and W_fc[1][0] as constants.
body_text:
optimizer.minimize(loss, var_list=[your variables]) will optimize over the list of variables.
But is there a way to optimize over a subset of a given variable while treating the rest of it as constants? What I mean is : say I have a 2D variable named W_fc of size 2x2. I want to optimize over W_fc[0][0] and W_fc[1][1] and treat W_fc[0][1] and W_fc[1][0] as constants.
body:
optimizer.minimize(loss, var_list=[your variables]) will optimize over the list of variables. 

But is there a way to optimize over a subset of a given variable while treating the rest of it as constants? What I mean is : say I have a 2D variable named W_fc of size 2x2. I want to optimize over W_fc[0][0] and W_fc[1][1] and treat W_fc[0][1] and W_fc[1][0] as constants.
